page.title: 04Houses with a History
page.content: {WYKE MANOR This interesting old house in the village of{Wick}was mentioned in the original{Domesday Book}and was owned by the church, then by famous people in history including Catherine Parr and Sir Walter Raleigh. The present owner's family have lived here since 1760. It has been a Tudor home, a Queen Anne Gentleman's Residence and was extended following the 1914-18 war. Extra rooms were built round a courtyard and a chapel was added. {PATTY'S FARMHOUSE -CROPTHORNE. It was built about the end of the 1500's. It is an interesting building stone at the bottom and timbered black and white upstairs. The farm was a mixed farm with a wool room, granary and dairies underneath. John Wesley preached from here when he rode about the country on his horse.
